title: Minutes of Tainan City Governmentâ€™s 414th Municipal Administrative Meeting 11/12/2019
content: Mayor’s Remarks:1. Last week, Tainan City Government held the first advisory meeting on investment promotion. We are committed to improving Tainan’s investment conditions, removing investment barriers, and enhancing public amenities around the city. Premier Su Tseng-chang instructed that the third phase construction of the Tainan Science Park is not merely an expansion of the industrial area; it should be more like developing a town and focus on enhancing public amenities in the neighborhood. Director General of the Bureau of Urban Development should follow the Premier’s instruction and implement measures that are in line with the central government’s policies.2. As we are approaching the second half of November and December, we are expecting numerous large-scale events and activities, which are expected to attract more tourists to Tainan. The Bureau of Transportation and the organizing bureaus or departments should make plans of traffic control and guidance and parking spaces in advance. The Police Department should help promote the relevant traffic policy and plans, and provide assistance on the day of the event. We don’t want to see traffic issue becoming a by-product of thriving tourism industry. Also, the Shan Shang Garden And Old Waterworks Museum and the Zuijhen Fossil Park has seen a stable number of visitors. The Cultural Affairs Bureau should come up with plan for joint ticket as soon as possible as we hope to see the number continue to grow at a steady pace.Announcements1. The Economic Development Bureau’s presentation on the 2019 Annual Report. (refer to written sources for details)Decision: Approved for reference filingMayor’s Remarks:(1) I would like to thank the Economic Development Bureau for their efforts in promoting green energy and achieving the objective of building 1GW of installed capacity prior to the scheduled due-date. Please carry on the good work and lead us to the next milestone—reaching 2GW by 2022.2. The Agriculture Bureau’s presentation on the performance report. (refer to written sources for details)Decision: Approved for reference filingMayor’s Remarks:(1) Thanks to the hard work of the Agriculture Bureau, sales of Tainan mangos in Japanese supermarkets topped 20 metric tons, resulting in a large growth in export value. In addition, it was the first time that pomelos entered Singaporean market. The Bureau should continue with the promotion and expand the market for Tainan’s quality produce to Southeast Asia.(2) With the increase of produce sales, farmers are asking for more roads and canals between farmland. The government has already allocated budget to fill up uneven parts of the road to make sure the quality and efficiency of produce delivery is secured.
